Job Title: Senior Software Engineer

Location: Bothell, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Senior Software Engineer (Platform) - Bothell, WA 

 FUJIFILM Sonosite, Inc.  -- If you are looking for work that matters, you’ll find it at FUJIFILM Sonosite. As the creator of point of care ultrasound, we dedicate every day to the innovation and development of imaging solutions that enable clinicians to provide improved healthcare in leading institutions, underserved populations and communities in crisis around the globe. At FUJIFILM Sonosite, we are in the relentless pursuit of answers that allow our customers to be confident that they are making the best clinical decisions for any patient, anywhere, anytime. Members of the FUJIFILM Sonosite team embody our company values: Go boldly, Stay curious, Passion fuels us, Respect each other, Own it and Act with integrity. Headquartered in Bothell, WA USA, FUJIFILM Sonosite is the proud recipient of numerous prestigious design awards and has in excess of 145 patents. Our point of care ultrasound systems are sold in more than 100 countries.

 External US 

Summary:

The primary responsibility of this role is to develop and maintain custom drivers running on the Fujifilm Sonosite flagship products. Requires competency in all aspects of the product level software development life cycle including requirements, analysis, design, implementation, and testing. Requires working closely with the broader software engineering team and other internal engineering teams. Qualified candidates will possess a good understanding of the Windows 10 kernel, RTOS, C/C++, PCI, I2C, has experience with DirectX, programming in multithreaded software environment, and possess a good understanding of the SOLID design principles. Candidates must be very team oriented and eager to work in a fast-paced environment and self-starter.

Essential Job Functions:

 Understand current driver functions, designs, development environment, and release process.  Make any required changes to device drivers.  Design, implement, and test system service features  Develop code running on a microcontroller  Participate in reviews of team member’s designs and provide feedback that helps improve overall system quality and performance.  Support integration of software modules with Hardware and System teams.  Conduct reviews of requirements, designs, and tests. Incorporate feedback as needed to improve performance, reliability, and robustness. 

Knowledge and Experience:

 Accredited Engineering Degree – BSCS/BSEE or related degree (Master degree preferred)  7+ years experience with software development for embedded systems  5+ years experience in developing with C++ in multithreaded applications  Extensive knowledge of Windows operating system fundamentals and peripheral integration  Experience with developing Windows kernel mode device drivers  Demonstrated proficiency with requirements analysis and documentation  Significant experience with software source control tools (e.g. Git)  Significant experience with ISO, FDA, or other regulated product development environments strongly desired.  Has an excellent understanding of the PCI and I2C communication protocol  Familiarity with C# development environment  Experience writing unit tests in Ruby  Familiarity with Linux 

Skills and Abilities:

 Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Must be available for working extended hours during critical phases of development programs  Ability to lift 25lbs with or without accommodations 

 Salary and Benefits: 

 $120,000- $155,000 + variable bonus opportunity  Insurance:  Medical, Dental & Vision  Life & Company paid Disability  Retirement Plan (401k):  4% automatic Company contribution  Fujifilm matches 50 cents for every dollar you contribute, up to 6% of your salary  Paid Time Off:  You can accrue up to three (3) weeks of PTO in your first year of employment  PTO increases based on years of service  Employee Choice Holidays:  Four (4) additional paid days off, based on date of hire in the calendar year  Paid Holidays:  Eight (8) paid holidays per year 
FUJIFILM Sonosite offers a fantastic compensation package, including benefits, and a 401k program. Visit us today to learn more about our exciting technologies and how you can make a difference. To apply and obtain further details regarding key responsibilities and experience requirements, check out our careers page at www.Sonosite.com/about/careers .

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

FUJIFILM Sonosite is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Americans With Disabilities Act

In compliance with the ADA Amendments Act, should you have a disability that requires assistance and / or reasonable accommodation with the job application process, please contact the Human Resources department via phone at 425-951-1200, or via e-mail at ffss-hr@fujifilm.com . Additionally, the affirmative program/plan is available for review upon formal request by employees and applicants for employment in the Human Resources office during regular office hours.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

#CB

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
